decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:

Application form; Existing Plans (Drawing number: PL_003) Revision A; Block Plan (Drawing number: PL_002) Revision A; Location Plan (Drawing number: PL_001) Revision A; Proposed drawings (Drawing number: PL_103) Revision A; Existing Drawings (Drawing number: PL_004) Revision A; Proposed drawings (Drawing number: PL_104) Revision A;

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless where stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), polices D1, and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | No part of the roof of the ground floor rear extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Ensure any upper floor window inserted on a wall or roof slope forming a side elevation is obscure glazed and non-opening, unless the parts of the window which can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which the window is installed, and remained at all times.

Reasons: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) along with Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).
description: Rear roof extension, and installation of two roof lights to front roof slope; part rear roof extension to rear outrigger roof slope, installation of window to side elevation; alteration to external side elevation involving removal of window to side elevation; single storey side/rear (wrap around) extension
